column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=[0103] An exemplary assay for serotonin according to the present invention is now described.
#Text=Nanoscale paramagnetic particles may be produced using an accepted method of coprecipitation of Fe.sup.3+ and Fe.sup.2+ in 6N NaOH at 85.degree.
#Text=C.
#Text=Equal molar equivalents of ferrous ammonium sulfate and ferric ammonium sulfate are added to 400 ml of deionized H.sub.2O.
#Text=The solution is then brought to between 85-90.degree.
#Text=C. and 850 ml of 6N NaOH is added over 90 minutes.
#Text=The resulting precipitated particles are separated and washed using a centrifuge.
#Text=Each aliquot of the particle solution is centrifuged at approximately 250 G for ten minutes.
#Text=The resulting supernatant is removed and the pellet is resuspended in Millipore water.
#Text=This procedure is repeated until the resulting solution is approximately pH 7.
#Text=[0104] The neutral paramagnetic particles are then coated by a reduction of silver nitrate on to the paramagnetic surface using a citrate reduction analogous to a Lee and Meisel procedure.
#Text=(Lee, P.
#Text=C.; Meisel, D., Adsorption and surface-enhanced Raman of dyes on silver and gold sols.
#Text=Journal of Physcial Chemistry 1982, 86, (17), 3391-5.)
#Text=Ninety (90) mg of silver nitrate is added to 500 mL of the neutral paramagnetic particle solution in a 1000 mL Erlenmeyer flask equipped with a large stir bar.
#Text=The solution is brought to a boil and 10 mL of 1% sodium citrate is added.
#Text=The solution is allowed to boil for 1 hr.
#Text=The paramagnetic particles act as aggregation sites for the reduction of the silver nitrate.
#Text=After 1 hr of boiling the black solution of PP becomes reddish-brown indicating a change in the optical properties of the solution.
#Text=Once cool, the volume is brought back to 500 ml.

#Text=[0105] The neurotransmitter specific coating is prepared by diazotizing 1.5 mg of a stock 5.0.times.10.sup.-3 M solution of the 0507 tether (Corcoran Research Group, University of Wyoming) (as the stable amine) in a 1-dram screw top vial.

#Text=Nine hundred (900) .mu.L of absolute ethanol purchased from Aldrich and 100 .mu.L of p-toluene sulfonic acid solution (PTSA, 100 mg/mL in absolute ethanol) is added to the 1.5 mg of the 0507 tether.
#Text=This solution is stirred with a micro-stir bar in an ice bath in a refrigerator at 0.degree.
#Text=C. for 30 minutes.
#Text=To form a diazonium, 2 .mu.L of butyl nitrite is added to the reaction mixture and stirred for an additional 30 minutes.
#Text=If stored below 0.degree.
#Text=C., this stock solution of diazotized tether can last for 2-3 days.
#Text=A yellow or rose color indicates the solution is no longer active.
#Text=The 0507 tether solution is further diluted to 1.0.times.10.sup.-4 M with Millipore water for use in experiments.
#Text=The addition of water also reduces the appearance of ethanol peaks in the Raman spectra.

#Text=The characteristic peaks of the 0507 tether are identified in the Raman spectrum from a blank consisting of 100 .mu.L of the 0507 tether and 900 .mu.L of silver-coated, paramagnetic nanoparticle colloid.
#Text=[0106] The next step is to determine the reactivity of serotonin with the 0507 tether and determine a detection limit.
#Text=A 1.0.times.10.sup.-3 M stock solution of serotonin is prepared with 2.1 mg of serotonin (Aldrich) diluted with 10 mL of 1.0 M Dulbecco's phosphate buffer (Aldrich).
#Text=Subsequent dilutions ranging in concentration from 1.0.times.10.sup.-4 M to 1.0.times.10.sup.-10 M are made in 1-dram vials and diluted with the Dulbecco's buffer.
#Text=A 0.1 M solution of sodium borohydride is used to reduce the excess diazonium back to the amine.
#Text=This form cannot react with itself to form an interfering dye.
#Text=The solution of sodium borohydride is made by dissolving 3.7 mg of sodium borohydride in 1 mL of 0.5 M sodium hydroxide solution.
#Text=The borohydride is important as the unreacted 0507 tether can constitute an interference in the assays.
#Text=By allowing the 0507 tether to react with the serotonin and subsequently adding the borohydride, the excess diazonium is reduced back to the unreactive amine form.
#Text=[0107] Five hundred (500) .mu.L of each of the 1.0.times.10.sup.-4 M 0507 tether solution and the serotonin solution, of the different concentrations, are added together in 1-dram vial.
#Text=An amount of sodium borohydride equal to 1% of the total volume of the solution is then added (10 .mu.L).
#Text=This is the reaction mixture.
#Text=In this solution, a reaction between the 0507 tether and analyte occurs and the excess diazonium is converted back to the unreactive amine form.

#Text=Ten 100 .mu.L samples are created by a serial dilution of this solution in order to provide a concentration range one order of magnitude lower than the original concentration of reaction mixture.
#Text=To each 100 .mu.L sample, 300 .mu.L of the colloid is added and placed on a vortex for three seconds.
#Text=This vial is placed into a Raman spectrometer (e.g., a Delta Nu Advantage 200A Raman instrument).
#Text=A Raman spectrum indicative of the seratonin is acquired within an average of 5-1 second acquisitions.
